value.title: Quantum computing foundations
value.excerpt: Intrigued by quantum computing but don't know where to start? This learning path helps prepare you for this exciting next generation of computing.

topItems.title: Create your first Q# program by using the Quantum Development Kit
topItems.excerpt: Get started with Q# programming by building a quantum random number generator.

topItems.title: Explore the key concepts of quantum computing by using Q#
topItems.excerpt: Learn the fundamental concepts of quantum computing by using the different tools of Q# and the Quantum Development Kit.

topItems.title: Solve graph coloring problems by using Grover's search
topItems.excerpt: Learn how Grover's algorithm can help you solve search problems such as graph coloring problems.

topItems.title: Solve optimization problems by using quantum-inspired optimization
topItems.excerpt: Learn how quantum-inspired algorithms mimic quantum physics to solve difficult optimization problems.

value.title: A Lap around the new Azure VM Extension | Azure Tips and Tricks
value.excerpt: In this video, you'll learn about the new Azure VM Extension for VS Code.   For more tips and tricks, visit: https://aka.ms/azuretipsandtricks   Get started with 12 months of free services and $200 USD in credit. value.title: Azure SQL fundamentals
value.excerpt: Learn how to deploy, secure, monitor and troubleshoot Azure SQL database.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure SQL
topItems.excerpt: This module introduces Azure SQL. Learn about various deployment options and service tiers and what to use for your organization.

topItems.title: Deploy and configure servers, instances, and databases for Azure SQL
topItems.excerpt: Deploy and configure servers, instances, and databases for Azure SQL

topItems.title: Secure your data with Azure SQL
topItems.excerpt: Secure your data with Azure SQL

topItems.title: Deliver consistent performance with Azure SQL
topItems.excerpt: Deliver consistent performance with Azure SQL

value.title: Distributed programming on the cloud
value.excerpt:
Learn about how complex computer programs must be architected for the cloud by using distributed programming.
In this module, you will:

Classify programs as sequential, concurrent, parallel, and distributed
Indicate why programmers usually parallelize sequential programs
Define distributed programming models
Discuss the challenges with scalability, communication, heterogeneity, synchronization, fault tolerance, and scheduling that are encountered when building cloud programs
Define heterogeneous and homogenous clouds, and identify the main reasons for heterogeneity in the cloud
List the main challenges that heterogeneity poses on distributed programs, and outline some strategies for how to address such challenges
State when and why synchronization is required in the cloud
Identify the main technique that can be used to tolerate faults in clouds
Outline the difference between task scheduling and job scheduling
Explain how heterogeneity and locality can influence task schedulers

In partnership with Dr. Majd Sakr and Carnegie Mellon University.

topItems.title: What is distributed programming?
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Learn about distributed programming and why it's useful for the cloud, including programming models, types of parallelism, and symmetrical vs. asymmetrical architecture.

topItems.title: Distributed computing on the cloud: MapReduce
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's cloud developer course. MapReduce was a breakthrough in big data processing that has become mainstream and been improved upon significantly. Learn about how MapReduce works.

topItems.title: Distributed computing on the cloud: GraphLab
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's cloud developer course. GraphLab is a big data tool developed by Carnegie Mellon University to help with data mining. Learn about how GraphLab works and why it's useful.

topItems.title: Distributed computing on the cloud: Spark
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's cloud developer course. Spark is an open-source cluster-computing framework with different strengths than MapReduce has. Learn about how Spark works.

images.title: Distributed computing on the cloud: MapReduce

value.title: Implement Windows Server hybrid cloud management, monitoring, and security
value.excerpt: This learning path addresses problems related to managing, monitoring, and securing a hybrid environment. After completing the learning path, you’ll be able to manage and maintain hybrid Azure and on-premises workloads.

topItems.title: Manage hybrid workloads with Azure Arc
topItems.excerpt: You will learn to describe Azure Arc, implement Azure Arc with on-premises server instances, deploy Azure policies with Azure Arc, and use role-based access control (RBAC) to restrict access to Log Analytics data.

topItems.title: Monitor Windows Server IaaS Virtual Machines and hybrid instances
topItems.excerpt: You'll be able to implement Azure Monitor for IaaS Virtual Machines in Azure, implement Azure Monitor in on-premises environments, and use dependency maps.

topItems.title: Audit the security of Windows Server IaaS Virtual Machines
topItems.excerpt: You'll learn about Azure Security Center and how to onboard Windows Server computers to Security Center. You'll also learn about Azure Sentinel, security information and event management (SIEM), and security orchestration, automation and response (SOAR).

topItems.title: Manage Azure updates
topItems.excerpt: You'll be able to enable Azure Update Management, deploy updates, review an update assessment, and manage updates for your Azure VMs.

value.title: Machine learning crash course
value.excerpt: A high-level overview of artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning. Modules are aimed at people with little or no knowledge of computer science and statistics. You will cover the essential concepts of AI and learn how to apply custom machine learning solutions with free, easy to use tools. You will learn simple but powerful ways that AI practitioners make predictions about objects, people, and the future. Then, you’ll cover exciting, complex topics you may have heard of, such as neural networks, computer vision, deep learning, and unsupervised learning.

topItems.title: Predict numeric values with regression
topItems.excerpt: Use machine learning regression models to predict numeric values. Build multiple variations of linear regression models to estimate things like internet traffic.

topItems.title: Make predictions from complex data with neural networks
topItems.excerpt: Use neural network models to make predictions. Change neural network structures to refine predictions using TensorFlow and Keras.

images.title: Make predictions from complex data with neural networks

value.title: Create a Clustering Model with Azure Machine Learning designer
value.excerpt: Clustering is an unsupervised machine learning technique used to group similar entities based on their features. Learn how to create clustering models using Azure Machine Learning designer.

value.title: Create a Regression Model with Azure Machine Learning designer
value.excerpt: Regression is a supervised machine learning technique used to predict numeric values. Learn how to create regression models using Azure Machine Learning designer.

value.title: Predict categories with machine learning classification
value.excerpt: Use machine learning models to categorize data. Build a logistic regression model and support vector machine models to predict categories like win/loss and tree species.

images.title: Predict categories with machine learning classification

value.title: Predict numeric values with regression
value.excerpt: Use machine learning regression models to predict numeric values. Build multiple variations of linear regression models to estimate things like internet traffic.

value.title: A lap around Azure Kung Fu Toolkit | Azure Tips and Tricks
value.excerpt: In this video, you'll learn about the Azure Kung Fu Toolkit. The Azure Kung Fu Toolkit contains lots of practical Azure CLI scripts and examples that you can easily use by replacing parameters and running the scripts.    For more tips and tricks, visit: https://aka.ms/azuretipsandtricks   Get started

value.title: Improve your reliability with modern operations practices
value.excerpt: The reliability of your systems, services and products has a direct impact on your success. Learn the modern operations principles and practices (and the Azure features that support them) that will help you achieve the level of reliability you need.

topItems.title: Improve your reliability with modern operations practices: An introduction
topItems.excerpt: Discover a map for navigating reliability challenges and sustainably achieving the appropriate level of reliability in your systems, services, and products.

topItems.title: Improve your reliability with modern operations practices: Monitoring
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use monitoring to help you sustainably achieve the appropriate level of reliability in your systems, services, and products.

topItems.title: Improve your reliability with modern operations practices: Incident response
topItems.excerpt: Learn the incident response fundamentals necessary to help you sustainably achieve the appropriate level of reliability in your systems, services, and products.

topItems.title: Improve your reliability with modern operations practices: Learning from failure
topItems.excerpt: Learn about post-incident reviews, a practice necessary to help you sustainably achieve the appropriate level of reliability in your systems, services, and products.

Geoff Langfield from Fidelity Investments (https://www.fidelity.com) joins Scott Hanselman to show how they're eliminating this friction by using automation

value.title: Cloud computing basics for developers
value.excerpt:
Learn about the basics of the cloud, including the history, building blocks, and types, in preparation for real-world cloud practice on Azure.
In this learning path, you will:

Learn about the history of the cloud, and how it was built
Know the major cloud providers and cloud types
Understand what types of resources are available through the cloud
Compare the economic benefits of the cloud
Design a datacenter and use a datacenter with a cloud service
Build apps on the cloud

In partnership with Dr. Majd Sakr and Carnegie Mellon University.

topItems.title: Foundations of cloud computing for developers
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Discover what the cloud is, the history of cloud computing, what types of clouds are available, and how you might use the cloud.

topItems.title: Economics of cloud computing
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Learn how developers pay to use the cloud and how cloud providers are able to charge for their services. Get an overview of how the cloud is kept secure.

topItems.title: Datacenter trends in cloud computing
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Datacenters are what power the cloud. Learn what they are, how they work, and challenges in managing them.

topItems.title: Datacenter components
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Take a deep dive into datacenters to discover how they are laid out and how computing resources are provisioned and metered.

value.title: Virtualization - Sharing cloud resources
value.excerpt:
Dive deeper into how the cloud works by understanding virtualization. How are computing power, memory, input and output, networking, and storage virtualized?
In this learning path, you will:

Get an overview of virtualization technology and how it is used in the cloud
Learn a formal definition of virtualization and its different types
Understand how CPUs are virtualized
Understand how memory is virtualized
Understand how I/O is virtualized
Understand how storage and networking is virtualized

In partnership with Dr. Majd Sakr and Carnegie Mellon University.

topItems.title: Share cloud resources
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Get an introduction to virtualization, one of the many technologies that power the cloud. Learn what virtualization is, its benefits, and how cloud resources are shared.

topItems.title: Understand virtualization
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Take a deep dive into virtualization by understanding its formal definition as well as the different types of virtual machines.

topItems.title: Virtualize computing power
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Learn about how computing power is virtualized using virtual CPUs. Covers different types of CPU virtualization.

topItems.title: Virtualize memory
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Learn how memory is virtualized to support cloud resources. Covers different types of memory mapping and related issues.

value.title: Explore Azure database and analytics services
value.excerpt: Learn about the database services that are available on Microsoft Azure, such as Azure Cosmos DB, Azure SQL, Azure Database for MySQL, Azure Database for PostgreSQL, as well as big data and analytics.

value.title: Create a classification model with Azure Machine Learning designer
value.excerpt: Classification is a supervised machine learning technique used to predict categories or classes. Learn how to create classification models using Azure Machine Learning designer.

value.title: Azure Security best practices | Azure Tips and Tricks
value.excerpt: In this edition of Azure Tips and Tricks, you'll learn about Azure Security best practices.
